text:
Phil your boots Liverpool transfer news: Brazil legend Rivaldo tips Philippe Coutinho to quit the Reds and sign for Barcelona 
Brazilian has been attracting interest from the Catalan giants as they plot a £60m swoop By Richard Forrester Comments BRAZIL legend Rivaldo has tipped Philippe Coutinho to quit Liverpool for Barcelona. 
The Reds ace has been attracting interest from the Catalan giants and they could launch a £60million offer this month. Reuters 5 Philippe Coutinho has been strongly linked with a switch to the Nou Camp 
Rivaldo spent a highly successful five years at the Nou Camp where he won two La Liga titles on top of winning the highly coveted Ballon d’Or award in 1999. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog. 
And the 44-year-old believes his fellow countryman should join international team-mate Neymar before admitting he thinks the transfer will happen. AP:Associated Press 5 Rivaldo believes his Brazilian compatriot should follow in his footsteps 
Speaking to Sky Sports , Rivaldo said: “In my opinion, he’s a great player and a player who knows Neymar well. I think they are both friends – players who stand out. 
“I think that this transfer might happen because Barcelona is always going to attract the best, isn’t it? 
“He is one of the players who stands out and I believe that this transfer – if he goes to Barcelona – would be a good thing for Barcelona for sure. Reuters Philippe Coutinho was crowned Brazil’s best player in Europe – pipping Neymar to top spot related articles High flyers Philippe Coutinho could make first start since injury return as Liverpool fly to Plymouth for FA Cup replay Read Paul about it Who is Paulo Dybala? Real Madrid and Barca target who is tipped for greatness - here's what we know A Cout above Liverpool ace Philippe Coutinho pips Neymar to be crowned Brazil's best player in Europe Team news Plymouth vs Liverpool team news: Philippe Coutinho makes his first start in six weeks on return from injury Reuters Rivaldo believes Philippe Coutinho should unite with his friend Neymar to form a formidable partnership PA:Press Association Images 5 Rivaldo has also tipped Gabriel Jesus for big things in England 
“He is a player who would definitely help Barcelona. Of course, Barcelona is a big club, but with a player like him, it would definitely be a big help.” 
Another Brazilian ready to make his mark in the Premier League is Manchester City’s new addition Gabriel Jesus. 
After penning international clearance, the youngster could make his debut against Tottenham on Saturday and Rivaldo believes Jesus is good enough to make ‘history in English football.’ Manchester City player Gabriel Jesus sings and dances in the Manchester snow 
He added: "He is a young player, he's only 19, and he has been playing football in England, which is hard football. It is not easy. 
"They need to be patient. He needs time to adapt to the cold. But he's a player who I believe will make history in English football because he's a great player.”
